findings.title: Low severity: Solidity style guide naming convention issues found
findings.description: The code does not conform to the Solidity styleguide.

findings.title: A floating pragma is set SWC-103
findings.description: The current pragma Solidity directive does not specify a fixed compiler version, which may cause bytecode variation between builds.

findings.title: Reentrancy SWC-107
findings.description: One of the major dangers of calling external contracts is that they can take over the control flow. In the reentrancy attack (a.k.a. recursive call attack), a malicious contract calls back into the calling contract before the first invocation of the function is finished.

findings.title: Assertions and Property Checking
findings.description: Solidity assert violation and AssertionFailed event.

findings.title: ERC Standards
findings.description: Incorrect ERC20 implementation.

findings.title: Incorrect ERC20 implementation
findings.description: The contract does not conform to the ERC20 standard.

findings.title: Solidity Coding Best Practices
findings.description: Outdated compiler version, no or floating compiler version set, and other best practices violations.

findings.title: Outdated compiler version
findings.description: Using outdated solidity compiler versions can lead to known bugs and vulnerabilities such as EmptyByteArrayCopy and DynamicArrayCleanup.

findings.title: No or floating compiler version set
findings.description: The current pragma Solidity directive does not specify a fixed compiler version, which can cause bytecode variation between builds and is especially important for bytecode-level verification of the code.

findings.title: Use of right-to-left-override control character
findings.description: Using right-to-left-override control characters can lead to issues with code readability and potentially introduce security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Shadowing of built-in symbol
findings.description: The finding indicates that a custom variable or function has been declared with the same name as a built-in Solidity symbol, which can lead to unexpected behavior and errors.

findings.title: Incorrect constructor name
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: State variable shadows another state variable
findings.description: This finding indicates that a state variable has been shadowed by another state variable, potentially leading to unexpected behavior and errors.

findings.title: Local variable shadows a state variable
findings.description: The issue arises when a local variable has the same name as a state variable, potentially leading to unintended behavior or errors.

findings.title: Function parameter shadows a state variable
findings.description: A function parameter has the same name as a state variable, which can lead to confusion and potential errors.

findings.title: Named return value shadows a state variable
findings.description: The named return value of a function shadows a state variable, potentially leading to confusion and unintended behavior.

findings.title: Unary operation without effect Solidity code analysis
findings.description: The unary operation does not have any effect on the code execution.

findings.title: Unary operation directly after assignment
findings.description: This finding highlights potential issues with unary operations performed immediately after assignments, which can lead to unintended behavior or precision loss.

findings.title: Unused state variable
findings.description: The contract has a state variable that is not being used.

findings.title: Unused local variable
findings.description: The finding indicates a local variable is declared but not used within the function.

findings.title: Function visibility is not set
findings.description: Function visibility should be explicitly set to ensure correct access control.

findings.title: State variable visibility is not set
findings.description: The visibility of state variables has not been explicitly set, which can lead to unintended access or modification.

findings.title: Use of deprecated functions: call code(), sha3(), …
findings.description: The contract uses deprecated functions such as call code(), sha3(), etc.

findings.title: Use of deprecated global variables (msg.gas, ...)
findings.description: The contract uses deprecated global variables such as msg.gas, which can lead to compatibility issues and unexpected behavior.

findings.title: Use of deprecated keywords (throw, var)
findings.description: The contract uses deprecated Solidity keywords 'throw' and/or 'var', which can lead to compatibility issues and security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Incorrect function state mutability
findings.description: The function's state mutability does not match its intended behavior.

findings.title: Does the code conform to the Solidity styleguide
findings.description: Code does not follow the Solidity coding best practices and style guide

findings.title: Convert code to conform Solidity styleguide
findings.description: The code does not follow the Solidity style guide and needs to be restructured accordingly.
